articles.author: Jill Gralow
articles.title: Horse guides rider fleeing Australian bushfires to find safety at pub
articles.description: Choking smoke from raging bushfires blocked Bec Winter's path to safety but she put faith in her horse Charmer to find a way, eventually reaching refuge in a local pub in the coastal town of Moruya, Winter said on Saturday.
articles.content:
Moruya, AUSTRALIA (Reuters) - Choking smoke from raging bushfires blocked Bec Winter’s path to safety but she put faith in her horse Charmer to find a way, eventually reaching refuge in a local pub in the coastal town of Moruya, Winter said on Saturday. 
Win… [+2428 chars]

articles.author: John Mair
articles.title: 'Too late to leave': Bushfires out of control across southeast Australia
articles.description: Bushfires burned dangerously out of control on Australia's east coast on Saturday, fuelled by soaring temperatures and strong winds that had firefighters battling to save lives and property.
articles.content:
SYDNEY/MELBOURNE (Reuters) - Bushfires burned dangerously out of control on Australia’s east coast on Saturday, fuelled by soaring temperatures and strong winds that had firefighters battling to save lives and property. 
By mid-afternoon, Victoria had 19 fir… [+3233 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.S.-led coalition did not conduct air strike near Taji, Iraq camp - spokesman
articles.description: The U.S.-led coalition fighting Islamic State said on Saturday it did not conduct any air strikes near Camp Taji north of Baghdad.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - The U.S.-led coalition fighting Islamic State said on Saturday it did not conduct any air strikes near Camp Taji north of Baghdad.

articles.title: To skirt police restrictions, some Indian protesters take a page from Hong Kong and beyond
articles.description: Before midnight on New Year's Eve, a call to action was sent on a private WhatsApp group - within the hour, dozens gathered in the centre of the Hyderabad, many holding banners to protest a controversial new citizenship law.
articles.content:
NEW DELHI/BENGALURU (Reuters) - Before midnight on New Year’s Eve, a call to action was sent on a private WhatsApp group - within the hour, dozens gathered in the centre of the Hyderabad, many holding banners to protest a controversial new citizenship law.

articles.author: Tabita Diela
articles.title: After Indonesia's deadly floods, few hear climate 'wake up call'
articles.description: Floods that killed more than 50 people in Indonesia's capital after the biggest rainfall since records began should be a wake-up call to climate change in one of the world's biggest carbon emitters, environmental groups said.
articles.content:

articles.title: Jakarta flooding deaths rise to 53, nearly 175,000 displaced
articles.description: Nearly 175,000 people remain displaced in Indonesia’s capital Jakarta and nearby towns, after flash floods and landslides killed at least 53 people, amid some of the heaviest rain since records began, authorities said on Saturday.
articles.content:

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.S. office vacancy rate rises marginally in fourth quarter: Reis
articles.description: The U.S. office vacancy rate rose marginally to 16.8% in the fourth quarter from a year earlier, according to real estate research firm Reis Inc.'
articles.content:
(Reuters) - The U.S. office vacancy rate rose marginally to 16.8% in the fourth quarter from a year earlier, according to real estate research firm Reis Inc. 
Of the 79 metropolitan areas covered by Reis, 24 showed an increase in vacancies in the quarter.
